text: I should have written this review back in February/March but forgot - must be an age thing.If you are contemplating going to Funchal, and you do not mind a bit of exercise (or getting buses/taxis), then this hotel is a MUST.A boutique hotel but with the service and quality you would expect for a larger, luxury brand hotel.The hotel manager was a god send - helped us out no end when we hit problems with our flight home.The room was lovely, very clean and wonderfully serviced each day.Our evening meals were wonderfully cooked and presented.I would be very surprised if we returned to Funchal (been there, done that - and it's a whole big world out there), but if we ever did, then I would return to The Quinta Mirabela.

Not great.  Main restaurant food quality very poor.  Mostly inedible, terrible tasting food.  Salmon made us all sick for two days.  Hot snack served between lunch and dinner was so bad we all spat it out, burger and hotdog tastes of Mr muscle cleaner.  Resorted to eating cold ham sandwiches from snack bar.  Stayed at cheaper 4 star all inclusive in Algarve with much better food quality, served right up to midnight, where this stops at 9:30. The hotel is too big with too many to cater for, so much food sat around for too long, flies were everywhere.  Wasn't cheap, won't be returning.  The two premium restaurants were delicious.

Quiet place, well sanitized, with pool that the kids liked, the staff very friendly and available, spacious apartment and comfortable beds. The kitchen should have more taps and cushions. Good place to go in family with children.

It was my third time in Herdade da Matinha, I've been there during summer, winter, spring and the atmosphere always changes perfectly. Even during the day, in the main house/ restaurant, you have details for breakfast, other mood at lunch and the light magic at night, with a romantic room!It's the perfect place to relax, eat wonderfully and enjoy the good and special things of life.

We arrived here was quiet.food is bland and very cold. Long time to get food.. staff wasn’t very trained at serving at bar or in restaurant. my husband got food poisoning few days before departure. The nights are very cold think hotel would provide patio heaters. The night entertainment is in a large tent. The entertainment was rubbish my 9 year and 12 year old wasn’t interested at all. Room wasn’t cleaned throughly just fresh towels and bed made up. I expected more cleaning they was dust and black mould around shower screen…Wouldn’t rate this a 5 star. Had better treatment in a 3 star hotel… wouldn’t recommend at all!!

Spent a couple of wet days here in March 2013, which spoilt our enjoyment a little bit as the weather was not appropriate for cycling, horse-riding or even walking. The accommodation was great, food was fantastic, English was well-spoken by all the management. Just a shame about the weather.

From the food to the pool to the service, this hotel has a special place in my heart.We spent 8 nights in this hotel last year and it was magical, from the views from your breakfast to the proximity to Dona Ana beach, it was perfect.The room was fully equipped with oven fridge etc.I would go back in a heartbeat.

Disappointing Decline – No Longer Worth the PriceWe’ve stayed at this hotel as a family three times now, with our first visit back in 2022 when free child places were available. That first trip was fantastic value—our daughter loved the pools, and the entertainment was genuinely impressive. The animation team went out of their way to make sure both kids and adults had a brilliant time.We returned in 2024. While it wasn’t quite as good as our first experience, we still felt it offered decent value, even though the free child places were no longer available. The food remained good, although the entertainment had noticeably dropped in quality.We've just come back from our most recent stay and sadly, the standard continues to decline. What’s particularly frustrating is that the cost of the holiday has almost doubled since 2022. The removal of free child places has clearly contributed, but even so, the overall price now feels expensive for what you get. It’s certainly not what I would consider a 5-star hotel experience.There are no longer any themed food nights, so the buffet is repetitive and quite bland—we often found ourselves resorting to pizza most nights. The restaurant service has also deteriorated; we were rarely asked if we wanted drinks, and staff seemed more focused on whipping away your plate the second you finish your last mouthful.The pool area was very busy, and unless you got up early to reserve a lounger, it was difficult to find a spot anywhere near the pool—not exactly relaxing. That said, the pool facilities and slides are still great fun for both adults and children. While the pools are unheated and quite cold, this hasn’t really bothered us as a family.Evening entertainment has become very limited. Aside from the animation team dancing each night—which is fine once, but repetitive after that—there wasn’t much else on offer.The lifts were another major issue. There’s supposed to be a system to reduce overcrowding, but in reality, they were slow, often full, and people frequently ignored the queueing system. One lift seemed to be out of order for the whole stay, which made things worse—especially for anyone staying on higher floors.Overall, it’s disappointing to see a hotel we once really enjoyed slide so far in quality while the price continues to rise. Unless significant improvements are made, we won’t be returning.

Our stay at Artbeat Rooms was an absolute pleasure and was a great base for exploring the city over a 3 day period. The hostel is about a 5 minute walk from Baxia tube - which in turn is an easy 30 min journey from the Airport metro. It can be a little tricky to find so look for the number 23 above some green double doors - just after a shop selling electric razors and other odds and ends.The hostel is in one of the only flat areas of Lisbon and its proximity to the waterfront made it very easy to find. An advantage that should not be overestimated!We stayed in the Hirst room which was comfortable and spacious - there is no cupboard space - but  there is enough room around to hang up clothes and store a suitcase or two without hassle. The highlight of the room is the balcony area overlooking the street which is perfect for breakfast or glass of wine in the evening. The restaurant below plays music - but amazingly it played a consistently good selection of relaxed songs that added to the ambiance over the trip.The hosts were very welcoming and their tips and fun map really added to our trip. I would recommend the evening of Fado at the Pavo restaurant for couples seeking some good food and Portuguese music. Also visiting Sintra is a must - the Quinta da Regaleira was our highlight - but make sure to bring a torch to explore all the secret passages. Make sure to get the combined Sintra train, bus and attraction pass from Lisbon town centre - we didn't and ended up queuing for ages when we got there!My only slight negative for Artbeat was the continental breakfast was quite limited if you are not a cereal or toast appreciator. However, you are given the full run of the facilities and are able to make fresh orange juice in the morning and take advantage of a cheap mini bar system in the evening which I enjoyed :)Overall - 100% recommend and would stay there again should I visit Lisbon in the future

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: We stayed at the Pine Cliff Ocean Suites for 4 nights in October. The resort was beautiful, open, spacious and well appointed. The rooms were large and the apartments were larger. The bathroom was the open type with sliding glass door. The Balcony opened out with a view of the pool. It was simply beautifully done. We enjoyed walking around the huge property, it took us 20 minutes to go from the Ocean Suites to the Residences where we had an event. The provide with you a vehicle for transfer if needed.The beach is a small walk down the cliff and it is just spectacular. Algarve is truly the Best Kept Secret in Portugal. The water is cool and the sand is white. I would love to go back there again.

The dancers Yoandry, Cinder, Norma, Leyanna and Iauro, the choreographer, had an artistic performance, risky, exciting and sensual. With his performance the night became cheerful, lively and stunning.Very good, highly recommend!!!

Amazing time yoandry, dayana and rey made it the best time for us getting all of my friends and myself involved in volleyball, table tennis and darts, definitely recommend to anyone looking to go to Albufeira

These lovely ladies who run the hostel are so welcoming, friendly and try their best that everybody become part of their big family and feels at home. Of course the place is beautiful and the surf can be great as well. So don't waste any time and visit captain's log houseZe, Sabina and Aoife, thank you for the great hospitality and the delicous food!

Stayed @ the cristal for 3 nights on trip to Porto. Very clean hotel very efficient & attentive staff & rooms clean and comfortable. Excellent choice buffet breakfast arrived at midday & rooms not ready so left bags with reception,

Our family of six (four adults, two children) stayed in the two-bedroom apartment, and enjoyed our three-night stay. Olivia, our proprietor, was fantastic and so helpful, allowing us to leave our bags early (we arrived several hours before check-in) to making restaurant recommendations for our family. The accommodations were modern, but I think six people in a two-bedroom apartment (with a sofa bed) and a very small water heater is a stretch. We made it work, but I think the space is far more suitable for four people. The location is amazing - a short walk to the major sites in Porto and Gaia, and surrounded by great shopping and just a few doors down from the port institute (you must go and do their port tasting flight!). Overall, I would definitely recommend Casas do Porto, and am very grateful to Olivia for her hospitality.

Great location, great hosts and staff, very generous with their time. Gave us good information and recommendations on area. Good breakfast and plentiful coffee in the morning. Clean. Stayed three nights. Simply wonderful. Would go back.

date: MC Sport Cwrote a review Feb 2024
text: Highly recommended. Great animation Suyin! Very kind and friendly. Marisol at reception was also great!Quiet atmosphere. Children's area with Suyin great! My son was very cared for and happy.Drinks, although they are white brands, are not bad.

Porto Bay Serra Golf is located at the heart of Madeira Island. Beautiful place, the hotel is cozy and the building is beautiful. Everything else was a disappointment. From the room which was in the 1st floor with a view to a fence to an nonexistent WiFi with no signal, fitness center with a very limited schedule and a very pricey restaurant (really pricey) where only the desert was somehow good. Service was friendly, but this is too short to give a better rating. Did't worth the time spent to go there.

Great sized and comfortable rooms. I read on other reviews about noise - we’re on the 2nd floor and it’s chilled. Good friendly vibe around the pool. Not a lot happening locally around the hotel but with Uber being well priced in Lisbon this isn’t a problem. I’ve left a separate review for the Tapas & Tiles bar/ restaurant which was a shocker as I don’t want to take away from the hotel itself.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We stayed at Reid's Palace for four nights on a recent trip to Madeira.  This place is amazing!  The hotel is beautiful - perched on a cliff above the ocean, just a short walk to the center of Funchal.  The service was outstanding at every level.  Every contact we had with anyone on the hotel staff was perfect.  Restaurants are all good.  We ate at the William, which was outstanding, and the breakfast buffet every morning is one of the best anywhere.  There is nothing I would change or could improve about any part of our stay.

Set on a dramatic coastline and surrounded by vineyards, this hotel is a great place if you want a quiet place.  Staff are very friendly and the restaurant and bar, in a separate building just down from the main building, have amazing views.  The food is excellent and waiting staff professional.  If we were to return to Madeira, this hotel would be a definite stay.

The main reason of this review is to thank Tatiana at the front desk.  She was so professional and courteous and friendly when we checked in on the night of November 6th.  That first impression makes all the difference in customer service.  Five stars to her!!This is a beautiful hotel.  The lobby is very spacious and wide.  The room was nice and clean.  And with our Marriott titanium status we had access to the lounge and that in itself was spectacular.  Both the breakfast in the lounge and in the basement were excellent.  I give five stars to every department at every level!!!  Good job!!!Coco and AlvinCanada

We stayed in 1B, the Lost in Translation apartment. The location is the best, right in the middle of everything. We had two (narrow) balconys, facing two directions. It gives you great opportunity to have coffe or wine in the sun, while you observe the people and the trams passing by outside.The apartment had everything we needed (or more), including a Nespresso machine, a dishwasher and Netflix. It was clean. The only downside, as we saw it, was that it was a bit noisy in the early night hours. There was traffic noise and people walking by talking loudly. We had no problem sleeping, but if you’re sensitive to noises you might want to pack ear plugs.However, we would stay here again, if we came back to Porto.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: The Belmondo hotel chain has been acquired by LVMH, which has invested heavily and is now refinancing the investments: Since I went to Reid's, prices have almost tripled! This is only for Nouveau-Riches, whom you used to meet less or true fans to endure. Location, service, beds, breakfast leave nothing to be desired. Unfortunately, there is no discount for solo travelers over couples, which feels outdated and discriminatory.

Read some of these reviews before we went to Clube Oceano and yes I was a little worried with some of the comments, but on our arrival we were pleasantly greeted and given the keys to our room, and also a map of the local area which highlighted the local supermarkets and other useful information.  We were on the top floor and had a good sea view and also a view of the pool which was ideal for people of all ages. Our apartment had everything you needed for a self-catering holiday, it was very clean and spacious,  the only minor down side was the bathroom which was a little tired looking, but this did not spoil our stay and was still functional. I can not fault the staff at the hotel, they were very friendly including the staff at the poolside bar. Ask if I would go again my answer would be yes. Old Town and the Strip are worth the visit it's a must that you try the Local dish Catalana

We have stayed at the Tivoli Carvoeiro several times now, and it's like a home from home! We're welcomed back like old friends by various members of staff, and we always find that we can relax straight away - a valuable asset when you consider the hectic lives we all lead. Yes, there are things about the hotel that need updating, but it's a great place to relax and we always feel very much at home and very welcome.

We returned to the Royal Savoy recently, having bought a time share room in 2003 and since then, making about 12 visits.There have been previous occasions when we have feared that the hotel was likely to lose its 5 star status, but not this time!We noted numerous improvements to the service and amenities in the hotel.  Firstly, the staff were far more welcoming and obliging.  I made a note of particular staff and mentioned them in my questionnaire at the end of our holiday, but pool, food and beverege staff at the decks, together with room maids were particularly pleasant.A lovely new touch were the Moulton Brown products in the bathroom and the beautiful basket of fruit provided in our room.The rooms had fresh bedding every other day and were kept scrupulously clean, together with our outside verandah.Only one complaint.  The wifi in all areas of the hotel was not good enough. I was unable to send an email for the whole of the two week period.However, that aside, we are very much looking forward to our next visit and I can thoroughly recommend the Royal Savoy to future visitors.

A very comfortable hotel/time share development. Two beautiful swimming pools, one extremely well heated. Direct access to the sea also. Nicely situated just outside of Funchal. Plenty of taxis if the hilly terrain of Madeira do not suit you. Otherwise, its a 20 minute walk into the centre.The outlook from the patios mainly good, although some are somewhat overlooked. All seemed to face the sea.The entertainment at night in the hotel was acceptable but not of a very high standard. I think in view of this, there wasnt a large crowd and as a lot of the guests are timeshare owners, they have seem the acts before and dont attend.Breakfast was excellent. A very wide choice of hot and cold foods, eggs freshly cooked as you wish and of a very good quality. The meals in the restaurant at night seemed expensive so we always ate out at one of the many local restaurants.Madeira has a relaxed pace of life, and the locals are particularly friendly. We were not there in summer school holiday time when the area is probably much busier and more families on holiday.

I was looking at my reviews on TripAdvisor when I saw my previous review of this hotel where I gave it 4 stars. Still not bad of course, but I wanted to write another review as me and my husband have been back to Saccharum twice(!) after my first review. So I thought about writing a new review. This is now our favorite hotel on Madeira, as it’s not as crowded like a lot of hotels in Funchal. Calheta is beautiful and not crowded at all. We really appreciate privacy and a calm environment when we go on holiday, and Saccharum is great for this! Sometimes restaurants are packed with other tourists and you’re seated a couple centimeters away from other guests but here at Saccharum you can eat all relaxed in whatever restaurant of the hotel you please. We really like the bar next to the sea, Calhau. They have nice vegetarian options for me. Also everything is clean and hygiene is great. That’s so important to me. So after our new experiences at this hotel I’ve wanted to change my 4-star review into a 5-star review. We are now planning to take my parents to Madeira in October of this year to show them this beautiful island, and we will be staying at Saccharum!

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We booked a weeks holiday with friends after the disappointment of having to cancel one in the Caribbean. What we found in Reid’s was a holiday that passed our expectations and has made us want to return for more.The modest roadside appearance of Reid’s belied the jewel that awaited us on arrival.Through the elegant reception area we got a glimpse both of the gorgeous views that lay beyond, but also the terrace where we enjoyed the famous afternoon tea during our stay.Our junior garden suite was spacious and extremely comfortable, and luckily for us convenient to the quirky lift arrangement which  indicated the history and development of the hotel.The staff were always attentive and happy to help. Mostly discreet, their part in making our holiday memorable cannot be understated. Some in particular should be mentioned: Wei on the door was always the welcoming face of Reid’s, Antonio preparing sun beds for guests was completing his last week in a 49 year employment (!!) and then most especially Basile an intern on his 8th consecutive day serving drinks and snacks in the pool area and at breakfast a highlight who went the extra mile and has definitely found his metier in the tourism industry.The view from the cocktail bar meant it became a stop off for a nightcap on the way back to our room.The gardens too are worth a visit.Thankyou to everyone at this splendid hotel. Special memories … we will definitely be back for more.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: I cannot believe it's 16 years since our last visit, a week in the summer here used to be a regular trip in the early 2000's. Some things have obviously changed but actually much remains the same - classic, traditional but not stuffy.Our room was in the Garden Wing and it's worth booking a sea view which takes in  bit of the garden, the sea, the port, the town and the hills. We spent a lot of afternoon and  evening time on our balcony which was also pleasantly private. The room is well furnished, queen bed and everything needed. Complimentary soft drinks are a nice touch. Maid service excellent - friendly and picked up some good tips for restaurants and walks from them.Meals. Breakfast is served in and outside the pool bar, a big improvement from it's previous location, We were able to sit outside every day and the breakfast food is  superb, both the quality and the huge variety. Daily specials in addition to the hot buffet are provided along with multiple juice and hot drink choices - amuse bouche pastries were another nice touch. We didn't use the pool bar in the day as we were usually out walking around the Island but we did eat in the Cipriani, the William and had afternoon tea on the famous covered terrace. TIP - do book these well in advance  as leaving this to arrival may leave you disappointed. The Cipriani was good, the William excellent (it is expensive but perfect for a treat) and the Afternoon Tea a must do for the experience alone (but the Champagne is overpriced with no other fizz option).Staff. A real highlight, everyone was so welcoming and friendly right the way through from reception,  the concierge team, the restaurant staff, the maids and the senior team - Sarah was very helpful and the Manager, Sr Campus was very visible throughout. There is a weekly welcome drinks evening  and also, in good weather, an outdoor Taste of Madeira dinner which combines great food and wine with stunning views.I would say communication of \what's on\" is a little hit and miss. There are two notice boards but I think many people would probably not see them and few events were communicated by any messages left in the room. For example
month: we only found out about the Taste of Madeira evening by looking at the website! We missed there was a  screening of the Coronation in the Cinema room and also we saw no details of what the spa facilities/treatments were.A novelty was the poolside is the daily visit of a Harris Hawk to help keep the pigeons and gulls at bay. Nice to chat with some of the handlers and see these wonderful birds up close.16 years was too long

text: We have been going  to the tivoli  hotel  for several  years  We have been  looking  to book  again  for next  year but nobody  seems  to  know  if  it  will  be  open  ..When  we  was there  in June  staff did not know  what  was happening. If anybody  has  any news  could  they let us know  we have contacted  jet 2 who we travel with  but they just say  we are waiting  to sign  contact  Many thanks

Well situated for old town and the strip (if you would ever want to visit)!!!. Transport to other mgm sites a bonus for granddaughter who was on holiday with us and facilities more towards children. Only used the Favours restaurant once and meal was excellent and reasonably priced. Eduardo provided excellent service and he can also make a mean gin and tonic.Entertainment every night however the price of drinks compared to pubs out and about we chose to go out. At least they are trying.Only downside was the family of 9 who used to reserve sun beds and parasosl and then take off for the day, I know this is a general complaint  and there were signs up but no notice taken of them, a suggestion would l d be to have a pool attendant to keep an eye on things as no one wants to fight for a sun bedBeing an infiniti member and paying a lot of maintenance every year, the least I would expect would be a sun longer

Spent a week there from 4-11Jun. a very lovely resort. Reception was smooth and fast. All staff are very friendly, helpful and speak good English.The room i stayed at 5th floor comes with kitchen, DVD player, TV, living room a terrace facing the sea; very spacious. We prepare our breakfast and had it at the terrace to enjoy the sea view. One lovely thing is the chocolate they placed on the bed after making up the room, delicious and sweet move...it has 3 pools. two outdoor pools with salt water, one warm and one cold. we just love it and spent at least 2 hour per day at the pool. ANother one we did not try is the indoor pool.There are many good restaurants around in  less than 5min walk; some are Michelin Star which I tried was fantastic. super market just 50m away. Casino is 500m away. Madeira center,  old town and marina and just within walking distance (10-15 min walk alone the sea).Food at the restaurant  is average, but service is excellent.One issue is the the road in front of the hotel is a slope. walking to marina and old town is ok, because is down hill. walking to main street above can be quite tiring because is uphill.Another thing is Wi-fi only available at ground floor and 1st floor at the library area. SO one will need to brig their laptop or smartphone to these area to access the internet.All and  all we had a wonderful stay at this lovely and quiet resort.

Great Place to Stay, Good Food, Good Swimming Pool, and Great Hot Showers, Stayed Here in October 2015, Weather Was Great For 9 Out of The 10 Days, Really Close to Many Top Golf Courses, Also 9 Hole Courses, Could Not Have Asked For More.

The hotel is situated in the best location in the Algarve in my opinion with the best beaches and coastal scenic spots on offer close by . Although the hotel is an older 4* and will need updating one day it’s kept immaculate by staff who cleaned our room every day . The staff were always polite and helpful and sorted any requests promptly. The WiFi is excellent and free which you can access virtually anywhere around the hotel and grounds outside . The breakfast wasn’t the best we’ve had in a hotel however there was always plenty on offer to choose from .

Great food and great service.Great room and great service all team @ MGMNice atmosphere near beaches. And Boat bar open all day.Great holiday well spent under the sun.Will be back next year with friends and Family again.

We stayed at Natura for a quick one week break in August and I have to say we were impressed for a late booking.We arrived early morning due to a very early flight and the 4pm check in is strictly enforced so there was no room available.  However, a very friendly receptionist started the check in process with us and then allowed us to leave our bags in the luggage room.  There were rest rooms in reception to change in and we then enjoyed the rest of the day by the pool before returning to reception at 5pm to get the room keys and finalise check in.  There is a refundable 100 euro deposit to pay but you are pre-warned and we got evey penny back depsite a very early check out on our way home, which was done by the hotel security - as long as you look after your room, I don't see why this would be a problem for anyone.When reporting back to complete check in after a very nice first day around the pool, the extremely helpful receptionist actually showed us to the room, whihc happens very rarely these days and was a nice touch.  We stayed in a pool view studio, which was just right for three of us.  We normally prefer a one bed apartment so that the bedroom is separated from the living space but this was the only available room at late notice.  It had everything you need though, three comfortable beds, a small tv, decent sized kitchen and bathroom with usual mod cons.  The main selling points of the rooms are the free air conditioning, which is very nice to come back to after a day at the pool.  The rooms also have a nice balcony and an electric shutter over the balcony doors, which as well as providing added security, also acts as an amazing black out blind if you fancy a lazy morning!The pool at the hotel was excellent, really nice big size with plenty of sun beds.  There is no real fight to get them and most weren't taken until well after 10am so no rushing to be up at the crack of dawn.  The beds also turn over during the day so there always seemed to be some available.  The hotel also has a lot of grassed areas around the pool so worst case scenario you can also just throw the towel down and still have a comfortable time.  There is also entertainment around the pool most afternoons from 3pm, which varies from bands to parrot shows so something for everyone.The hotel had a really nice atmosphere, very friendly and helpful staff and was well located.  At the top of the road are a number of restaurants and a big intermarche supermarket.  There is a taxi rank a little further down the road, though you are in walking distance of the strip.  The distance to the old town really probably requires a taxi at between 5-8 euros, though it can be walked if you want to work up an appetite for the evening!We had a great stay and would certainly return.

Stayed here in May 2016 absolutely fantastic service and the staff are brilliantBruno the  young lad around the pool was very helpful nothing was too much trouble he is a real credit to the HotelI would definitely recommend this Hotel5 min walk to the  MarinaMy friend shoe's needed heeled and the taxi driver took us to the door and came into translate for us..The shoe's were going to take half an hour so the taxi driver said he would take us back to the hotel and go back later and collect her shoe's and take them to  Reception at the hotel... He did this and the hotel staff placed them back in her room can't fault that service.I  found the bed's very hard and uncomfortable but Bruno got me one of the other one's every day.Definitely booking for next year.

This hotel has such fantastic reviews we expected something amazing so needless to say we were slightly disappointed. The hotel was clean enough and the location was good. Most of the staff were polite. Our room was very basic..it was tired and there was an issue with the shower flooding which made the apartment smell somewhat unpleasant. However staff did deal with the flooding issue not long after we made them aware.

Every thing was according what we expecting , . Actually I was recommended by friends they talk about boris the good vibes in that hotel and was true , we spent good time , we took part in activities.. we enjoy a lotThe publication of the hotelIs perfect
Just perfect.  Welcoming, super friendly, helpful, amazing location and food on site (well, within 3 minute walk at their restaurant and pizzeria).  Cant wait to go back.

hotel_name: Cidnay Santo Tirso - Charming Hotel & Executive Center
text: If you have a business trip on Santa Tirso area this hotel is best place to stay. It is far away from the center, half hour approx from the airport by car. Have very nice bar outside and in the summer time local persons come to take a time. Have good breakfast. In the middle of very green and silent area.

We stayed here for five nights over New Year 2023. First and foremost, the location is excellent, close to most of the main sights and convenient both for the train station and metro giving convenient access to the airport. We stayed in a comfortable one bed studio with kitchenette and adjoining lounge area, the one featured on the website which is representative of the actual room. The studio also backs onto the rear garden so it was very quiet even though it was the New Year holiday. Kitchenette was very well equipped with refrigerator, coffee maker, electric kettle, oven, two ring hob and plenty of utensils. TV had Netflix/Prime. Very comfortable bed, good shower with plenty of hot water and plenty of space to make our stay a good one. We opted for the daily continental breakfast which is delivered to your door daily and is quite substantial with fruit, yoghurt, croissants, bread coffee or tea and juice.Very friendly staff made this an excellent stay.

We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and 3 days, we chose the hotel for the roof top outdoor pool and also for the gym both of which were disappointing. The pool on the roof is tiny and waist deep at most, itâ€™s fine for cooling off but notice swimming or sharing, there is no bar service on the roof and only 3 thin umbrellas for shade, the loungers are poor quality too. It does have good views and is a sun trap however hence need for umbrellas.The gym is again tiny with limited equipment and space, a wooden floor which makes working out harder as things make a loud noise all the time, no music and no AC it is in the spa and hence spa temperatures. Not enjoyable at all so I ended up running out side where there is a nice long track along the river.The room itself was fine but not 5 star, the AC made the room feel damp and sticky, the housekeeping mediocre.Front desk were helpful but when checking in didnâ€™t mention anything about where things are or when breakfast is etc. Breakfast is just ok there is a menu to order eggs but you have to beg for it and then the options are limited. No granola and no smoothies and very standard selection on buffet.The bar is dark and soulless outside is nicer but service can be slow.We still had an average stay and there is a nice option of walks near to the hotel and town in an Uber is 8 euros which is what we expected however we wouldnâ€™t stay again as it was more 3 star than the luxury portrayal on the website which has some creative photograph to say the least.

Beautiful hostel tucked away from the noise of the town center but easily walkable. Incredible outdoor pool to lounge in the sun by and play pool Olympics in. Amazing roof terrace bar where you can chill on beans bags, enjoy the sunset, meet some awesome people, drink sangria and be merry! Delicious unlimited pizza and bbq once a week and legendary staff. This place has got it sorted!!

We booked this last minute Thursday flew Friday.  We chose a De-lux room and were not disappointed. Aircon was brilliant, clean towels every day.  We also had Bed and Breakfast with the deal.  There was plenty of choice and it was quite good.  Pool area very clean and tidy and not a big rush for beds in the morning.  Drinks were a bit pricey at the bar but other than that we had a great time.  Location is great as very quiet at night but the complex is within easy distance to all amenities.  Would definitely go back.  All staff were very helpful and friendly.

My stay at this hotel was for one night.  Very comfortable and clean.  Recently renovated.  Staff was very accommodating and courteous.  Walking distance from the Shrine and bus. Many shops and restaurants close-by

Stayed here for 8 nights on B&B basis at the beginning of July.Very pleased with the service we received from housekeeping, waiting-on staff and especially reception staff, in particular Louisa and the lady with the blonde hair who helped me after a fall. Our room (Classic double with garden view) was on the 7th floor (top) and had views of the surrounding gardens, (but not the hotel's) neighbouring complexes and the road. A reasonable view, if not quite what was advertised.  The WiFi and air conditioning worked well in our room and the little kitchenette was very useful for 2 people who ate most meals out, but i'm not sure how a family would cope as there is no cooker.  But for us the fridge, microwave and kettle were adequate and the cupboards well stocked with cutlery and crockery, even a pair of scissors and a corkscrew (both came in very handy).  The only things you need to buy are washing up liquid and a dish cloth.  Which are a reasonable price from the large supermarket at the top of the road.I would have given this hotel 4 stars but for the following things:The décor in the room was worn and needed refreshingOn the last 2 days of our holiday the hotel became much busier and there was an immediate decline in the standard of the facilities, i.e. no toilet paper or hand tissues in the toilets in the communal areas.  At breakfast, which for the rest of our stay had been excellent, both in choice and quality of food (except the juices and coffee which are truly terrible!), it was impossible to find a table that was set, I ended up colleting the cutlery and setting a table myself, no expresso cups - I think this is because the expresso was the best of the drinks from the machine, so therefore the cups went first.The grounds, pool area and facilities were all good, however, in the last couple of days the indoor pool became impossible to swim in as there were many unsupervised kids messing about with no regard for anyone trying to swim.The evening entertainment was limited, but on the night it was on the band/singers were very good.We had a lovely holiday and the area is stunning.  The hotel, which I would say is not quite 4 star, was reasonable for the price that we paid and we would go back again, if we were offered the same deal, but a week or 2 earlier to avoid the sudden influx of guests.

date: The French Leekwrote a review Jan 2020
text: My wife and I stayed here as a late booking, being close to our Portuguese solicitors office. Upon arrival we were greeted by long queues of people either checking out or complaining to the front desk. No welcome or anything as we entered with our cases. After 30mins waiting I had to really kick up a fuss to my wifeâ€™s embarrassment to get more staff to check us in or we were going to leave. Eventually getting to our basic room, we checked out the hotel. By night the bar area was rowdy most nights with groups you g men playing electronic darts and drinking heavily so we went elsewhere after that. Breakfast was an equally noisy and busy affair, queuing for tables with people feasting like it was their last supper. We were so sorry we hadnâ€™t booked the Maria Nova in town where we had stayed many times, but thought we would have a change. Never again....

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: It's a wonderful hotel and spa. People are very kind and the hotel is an excellent 5 stars ! Don't search more ! Choose this and enjoy the view from the rooftop !The breakfast is so good and very qualitative:-) sure you must go to palacio hotel in #Porto.

hotel_name: Cidnay Santo Tirso - Charming Hotel & Executive Center
text: This 4 star hotel has everything any travel needs. The staff the architecture the breakfast, all makes You feel at home. In the quiet town of Santo Tirso, over looking the mountain so cosy. only 25 Km from Porto and perfect for business if You are on the north of Porto.

Very Dubai or Abu Dhabi style hotel in the Lisbon Expo zone. Designed, big, spaceous, right at Tejo River. Fantastic terraces on ground floor and on the top (closed in winter season). Definitely unique for Lisbon. We spent christmas day for brunch and it was surprisingly good! Great food selection, fabulous view over the river, very friendly and professionel staff. That is not always a given in Lisbon! And even the price was reasonable. We might do that again next xmas! It is quite a way from losbon center either by car (parking available) or by metro.

I had a great stay at the hotel! The service was impeccable, from check in to check out.Functionalists were very attentive and helpful. The Mood and welcoming. Room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The location is excellent and the breakfast exceeded my expectations. I will definitely come back and recommend it to everyone!

No complaints for this hostel. Staff was helpful.  The dinner was great and cheap. Met a lot of people with the dinner and bar crawl combo. Cheap drinks at the bar and walking distance to anywhere. The beds were comfy and guests were respectful.

The hotel is very well located, right on The city center. The rimos are spacious, sunny and very clean. It has a indoor and a outdoor pool. The Wifi signal is very good in all the complex. The restaurante is the down point for me in the experience, because The options are limited and The food is only normal, not great. Overall i would recomend this hotel to a short and quiet stay in Tomar.

Wow . . . talk about a total package! Ambiance, ambiance; location, location, location. Significant aesthetic blend of old world and modern architectural, design, and landscaping elements, nestled in a charming, quiet, safe neighborhood within easy walking distance to all that Cascais offers including seaside and train to Lisboa and other remarkable Portuguese locations. (Parking is no problem, but who needs a car....) Casa Vela is your luxury, reasonably priced Portuguese home away from home. A place to relax and recharge. Staff is most accomodating, helpful, and informative. This is not simply a \hotel\"; it is a \"guest house.\" One is not renting a room...one is a guest invited to enjoy the experience. Take your time with delicious breakfast; walk the grounds; chat it up with the staff or other guests in the cozy salon; or simply \"chill\"; meditate
month: play chess or cards; read a book; take a swim; sip some Porto
extracted_date_str: or cafe in the comfortable salon or contemplative gardens; share with your partner...Engage the Cascais and greater Lisboa and Belem communities at your doorstep confident that a warm welcome and good \"vibes\" await your return to Casa Vela.  Enjoy!"

date: Caveat Viator Cwrote a review Aug 2013
text: This place is good, no to be fair, it's very good. The owner is as polished in customer service as the marble in hallway. We have previously stayed in the Albatross for considerably more money but despite the distance from the beach this place beats it. Great local recommendations for inexpensive but quality food. All in all this place reminded me of why I first really liked Portugal. Only request is to make an indoor shower available for late check outs, small thing but means a lot.

I wouldn't post again all great things said before about Casa Vela. Few minor issues that slightly disturbed us: our room was relatively small; the toilet and bath doors were modern but rather symbolic, couldn't hide anything as made only by glass, with no locks - that disturbed us and our child since we are rather conservative people and require personal privacy; the breakfast was not so rich compared to that in other similar hotels in Portugal. Otherwise it's a great place.

Once again, we were led to the perfect choice by tripadvisor reviewers. This inn is easy to find in this charming town of twisted, narrow streets.  As soon as you go through the town gates, the albergaria is straight ahead.  You will be warmly greeted by Dom Manuel.  He is the designer, owner and proprietor and is quite proud of the inn he has created.  And he deserves to be proud!Our room was on the second floor with french doors on two sides of the room and a balcony/patio  that poked out of  the roof----the views of both the valley (one way) and the town and castle(the other way) were just fantastic.  When making a reservation, request  one of the rooms with a view--I can only assume that it will make your stay even more special.The room itself was  good size.  It was charmingly decorated and immaculately clean.The bathroom was modern and stocked with all of the amenities.We ate dinner in the inn's restaurant.  It was a very pleasant atmosphere and the food was fine......we didn't see many other choices in town and were too tired to go to the pousada (which, by the way, is very hard to find and when we did we also saw swarms of  flying insects.....not at all impressed and we were very happy we had not spent the extra money to stay there).Did I mention the unbelievably low rate for this inn?  We paid 65 euros--the least on our trip---and this was really a wonderful property.  Do not be afraid to book due to the very low price----it is worth far more!

I travelled with my wife to Lisbon to celebrate her 40th birthday.  I had e-mailed the hotel when booking and, on arrival, was upgraded to a deluxe room with spa bath on balcony etc.  Check in was smooth and easy and although the room wasn't ready, the wait was well worth it.  We were escorted to the room and all facilities explained.  Faultless.Breakfasts were ok - I am a pastry fiend so the continental breakfasts suited me well.  Would have liked self service coffee though as I need this by the gallon to get going.We had dinner in the hotel's gourmet restaurant for my wife's birthday which was expensive but well worth it.  A birthday cake and sparkling wine awaited us on our return to the room.  A very nice touch.We spent one afternoon in the spa which is the best I have experienced.  Would have liked to have spent more time here!Location - we had no problem with this.  Belem is beautiful and the Torre, monastery and discoveries monuments are only a stroll away.  The Pasteis de Belem pastry heaven again is only a short walk away and is unmissable.  There are various other restaurants in the area as well as the hotel's own less formal restaurant.  You can catch the no.15 tram at the monastery as well as a number of buses and can therefore be in central Lisbon within minutes.  Both trams and buses are plentiful.All in all it was an excellent stay and I don't think I could have chosen better.  I have stayed in a number of 5 star hotels and this rated highly, perhaps not for the public areas but for the room and service.(Lisbon tip - Wine Bar de Castelo - one of thebest afternoon's I have spent with great wine , fantastic cheeses and meats and very knowledgable and friendy hosts)

The rooms are spacious and airy, well equipped, quiet, with a beautiful view. Easy to reach by car, staff is friendly and helpful. The Spa needs to be reviewd, no staff, no shower, no Jacuzzi... Nice pool, beautiful garden. The Nove Restaurant was closed. The buffet restaurant is really poor, in quality , in assortment and in food presentation with empty trays not being replaced, very poor choice especially if one does not eat fish. We were on half board, but after two days we decided to have dinner elsewhere! Breakfast buffet slightly better. In a few words, good hotel but 👎👎👎 to the food!

HF Fenix is located at a beautiful square full of hotels close to the city center. The size of the double room is quite good. The breakfast is also very good and the employee at the reception off the breakfast is really full of energy with a big smile. Negative that I had to wait 15' at the reception to check in without reason and the ex could have been cleaned better.

We stayed in a lovely room and enjoyed our holiday at the Casa vela Guest House. We were warmly welcomed and the Guest House is very easy to find.The hotel is just wonderful. The hospitality was lovely, and the breakfast delicious. Just a perfect hotel to stay for a holiday ! The garden is gorgeous.

date: Viagens sem fimwrote a review Oct 2024
text: Very cosy Inn and with a magnificent claustro. We were welcomed with a lot of sympathy from receptionist Raquel Ribeiro who gave us a presentation of the history of the Inn which made even more interesting this our coming to Viseu.The Inn is close to the center which enabled us to meet Viseu on foot.I recommend

My fiance and I spent only 1 day in Cascais and stayed at Onyria Quinta da Marinha Hotel. What an amazing hotel, recently renovated with a modern design! We were welcomed by the friendly and helpful staff who ensured we had a lovely stay. The room was very clean and nicely renovated offering stunning views over the golf course.The location of the hotel was just perfect, in a very quiet area but at the same time still close to the main road. This is perfect if you are planning to ride the bike along the coast. All in all, great food and high quality service. We will definitely be back soon again!

A fantastic view over the sea of Figueira da Foz. Sossego, sympathy of employees and owners with very good service. For those who want a few days between the mountains and the sea advice. Combining a good rest with one of the many traditional dishes gives encouragement to the soul.

We loved staying at O Castelo Guest House! The view from our room was magnificent! We loved enjoying our tasty breakfast on our balcony. The staff was great with booking restaurant and kayak reservations. The only negative was the quality of the pillows and towels. The towels were gray and the pillows like a rock. Besides that, everything was perfect!
